author: Megan Leonhardt
title: U.S. economy is in a 'medically induced coma,' but that doesn't mean we're heading into a depression just yet
description: The dramatic economic slowdown caused by coronavirus has led many experts to predict that the U.S. will enter a recession this year. Some are even fearful we could enter a depression. But is this just hyperbole, or is the U.S. economy truly in deep trouble?
content:
In the months since Covid-19 has emerged as a global health crisis, countries around the world have shuttered businesses and told citizens to stay home in an attempt to mitigate the effects of this deadly virus.
